content.question: Which of the following statements best explains why African American Studies scholars refer to the period between the end of Reconstruction and the beginning of the Second World War as the nadir?

choices.label: This period is described as a time of hope, with federal support for the reunification of African American families separated by enslavement.
This period is seen as an era of progress, with political participation increasing for many Americans regardless of race.
This period is viewed as a time of economic hardship for African Americans with the introduction of the repressive system of sharecropping.
This period is considered the lowest point of American race relations because of the many public, overt acts of racism.

content.answer: This period is considered the lowest point of American race relations because of the many public, overt acts of racism.
